content.description:
This is the crack system on the corner of the formation, just left of Desert Sky. Start by traversing up and around a big grainy flake, above where the rock quality improves considerably. Follow the crack up to the large roof with very fun moves, and finish with a few more nice crack moves to the top.

See the photo by Blitzo for a picture of a climber on this route.

climbs.name: Turtle Vein
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Dave Evans, Marge Floyd, Todd Swain, and Randy Vogel, September 1990

content.description: a face climb with long runouts on easy climbing

climbs.name: Too Obvious
climbs.fa: Rick Ledesma and Reese Martin, March 1988

content.description:
This easy to spot line lies just east of the Split Rock parking area.

Climb up huecoed face for 10' (same as Environment-Oil President) to gain right-angling crack.  Follow the awkward, slightly grainy hand crack to the top of the formation.

Belay on gear.

Circuitous descent off the backside of formation.

climbs.name: Porky's Excellent Adventure
climbs.fa: FA Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford, Steve McCallister, and Mary McCalliste, February 1991

content.description: a face climb with smearing moves

climbs.name: Nipple, The
climbs.fa: Herb Laeger and Eve Uiga, February 1979

content.description: awkward and runout moves up a shallow, arching crack

This  climb is located of the east side of Split Rock South formation...the back side facing away from the parking lot.  Find the big boulder/ formation called the Popcicle.  It is behind and up of the Popsicle to the west.  It is about 50 feet to the right of cleared for take off.  Scramble up through Boulders and bushes to get to this climb.  There is sort of a path/ trail of sorts.  There are two routes on this shabby formation.  Joshua Tree Coffee is the left route.  Both routes share the same anchor.
content.location: From the high ledge up and west of the Popcicle, climb past three bolts to a bolted anchor.

content.description: Climb up past four bolts to a bolted anchor shared by Joshua tree coffee.
content.location: Located on the backside of split rocks south, ..the east face, and facing away from the parking lot. It's is about 50 right ( or north) of the climb Cleared for Takeoff.  It is behind ( west) and above of the large boulder/ formation The Popcicle.  There are two routes on this face.  Joshua Tree Brew is the right on.  Both routes share the same anchor.

climbs.name: Desert Sky (aka Environment-Oil President)
climbs.fa: Rick Ledesma and Reese Martin, March 1988

content.description:
Seemed like an appropriate route to climb given the current political climate.

This line can easily be seen to the east from the end of the Split Rock parking loop.  Huecoed face climbing leads to a right-angling crack and good pro.  Instead of following the crack, continue straight up past 3 bolts with old hangers, make a delicate move left along a small dike, and continue up along the arete on easier terrain. Bring a few pieces to build an anchor.

As typical for Josh, the descent may be the crux.

A good choice for a cold day.
content.protection: 3 bolts + a few pieces to 2" for protection before the first bolt and to build an anchor.

climbs.name: Cleared For Takeoff
climbs.fa: Jon Lonne, Herb Laeger, and Rich Smith

content.description:
This prominent overhanging thin hands / fist crack is on the east face of Split Dome. The superb rock quality makes this short but powerful climb well worthwhile.

Jam the crack and use holds on either side for hands and feet. The initial crack ends in a small "cave." At this point a thin seam goes directly over a roof (thin cams and stoppers for protection)to the top or a left-slanting fist crack can be climbed to the top. Placing protection is the crux.
content.protection: 1" - 3.5" Cams and medium stoppers provide excellent protection for this overhanging crack. Medium cams are necessary for an anchor in a horizontal crack behind a ledge at the top.

content.description: This climb goes left out a short ramp/seam, then straight up past 3 closely spaced bolts to the top.
content.protection: QD's for the bolts...maybe a piece before the bolt...pieces for an anchor.
content.location: On the right just before you get to the Parking lot of Split Rocks.
